questions.clue: In 1687, Isaac Newton published his laws of motion and universal gravitation in this work.
In 1869, this Russian chemist created the first periodic table of elements, predicting elements yet to be discovered.
In 1915, this physicist presented the general theory of relativity, revolutionizing our understanding of gravity.
In 1953, this duo published the double helix structure of DNA, earning them a Nobel Prize in 1962.
In 1986, this physicist proposed the concept of a 'topological quantum computer', which could revolutionize quantum computing.
This winged horse sprang from the blood of Medusa in Greek mythology.
In Norse mythology, this sea serpent encircles the world and is destined to fight Thor during Ragnarok.
This creature is a part lion and part eagle and is often depicted as a guardian in ancient Middle Eastern art.
Originating from Japanese folklore, this water-dwelling creature is known for its mischievous behavior and has a dish of water on its head.
This creature from Slavic folklore is a witch-like being who lives in a hut on chicken legs and is known for her ambiguous morality.
This composer created the iconic score for 'Star Wars', which includes the famous 'Imperial March'.
Hans Zimmer composed the score for this 1994 Disney animated film that features the songs of Elton John.
Maurice Jarre won an Academy Award for his score for this 1962 epic about a British officer in the Arab Revolt.
This composer is known for his minimalist style and scored the films 'The Hours' and 'The Truman Show'.
Ennio Morricone composed the score for this Sergio Leone film, known for its 'Ecstasy of Gold' track.
questions.answer: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly

questions.clue: This 1919 treaty ended World War I and imposed heavy reparations on Germany.
This 1955 treaty established Austria as a neutral and sovereign state post-World War II.
Signed in 1648, this collective name refers to the treaties that ended the Thirty Years' War in the Holy Roman Empire.
This 1968 treaty seeks to prevent the spread of nuclear weapons and promote peaceful uses of nuclear energy.
This 1713-1715 series of treaties concluded the War of the Spanish Succession and redrew European borders.
This Parisian landmark, completed in 1889, was the tallest man-made structure until 1930.
This dam, completed in 1936, was once the world's largest hydroelectric power facility.
Spanning San Francisco Bay, this bridge was the longest suspension bridge in the world when it opened in 1937.
Opened in 1994, this underwater tunnel connects the UK and France beneath the English Channel.
This space telescope, launched in 1990, has provided some of the most detailed images of the universe.

final.clue: Completed in 1889 for the Exposition Universelle, this structure was initially criticized by Parisians and artists as an eyesore.
